intro: Torularia karatavica, commonly known as the Karatavica torula, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it plays a minor role in local ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
